clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Second-line Treatment With Apatinib for Advanced Intrahepatic Cholangiocarcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: Single Arm, Exploratory and Open Clinical Trial of Second-line Therapy With Apatinib Mesylate in Advanced Cholangiocarcinoma

lead_sponsor.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital of Zhengzhou University

clinical_study.source: The First Affiliated Hospital of Zhengzhou University

brief_summary.textblock: The propose of this study is to confirm safety and efficacy of Apatinib monotherapy in patients with advanced cholangiocarcinoma.

primary_outcome.description: the percentage of patients with advanced or metastatic cancer who have achieved complete response, partial response and stable disease

secondary_outcome.description: Time from start of treatment until the first documented event of symptomatic progression or death.
Proportion of patients with reduction in tumor burden of a predefined amount
from start of treatment to death from any cause, or last known date of survival

arm_group.description: Apatinib 500mg, once a day, oral of each 28 day cycle. Number of cycle: until progression or unacceptable toxicity develops.
